title: How to Soak Your Toes for a Pedicure

steps.headline: Fill a plastic tub with warm water.
steps.description: Make sure it is warm, for cold or hot water will not help make it more enjoyable or relaxing.

steps.headline: After that, add Epsom salt to the water.
steps.description: If you would like a more relaxing, spa-like pedicure experience, you can also add in your your favorite scented oil.

steps.headline: Now, place your feet in the water and soak for at least ten whole minutes.
steps.description: Try using a timer. Soaking your feet as long as possible will help you remove the dead skin easily later.

steps.headline: After soaking, remove one foot (right or left, your preference) from the water and leave the other to soak.
Rub a pumice stone on the bottom of your foot (the one taken out from the water), concentrating on the roughest areas.
steps.description: Foot files also work well for removing dead skin. Try both to see what works best for you.

steps.headline: Place the foot you just scrubbed back into the water and repeat the previous step on the opposite foot.
Remove your feet from the water and gently pat them dry.
